reviews.text: 1. On arrival, our television needed re-setting , which a member of staff, who came up immediately, took at least 15 minutes to rectify - surely, when the room is serviced, this should have been checked, before new guests arrive!
reviews.title: Great Food but beware of Reception staff

reviews.text: 2. The bed collapsed when my husband sat on the corner of it! One of the legs actually came off.
reviews.title: Congratulations I've found a hotel that truly understands the word hospitality.

reviews.text: 3. On neither the Monday or Tuesday morning did we receive the paper we had ordered, even though we had reported this to Reception on the Monday!
reviews.title: Food and bar review only as didnt stay over night in hotel

reviews.text: We have eaten in the La Roche restaurant on numerous occasions and always been very pleased with the service, the food and the environment. Our recent visit started by being greeted by the sight of a rather scruffy looking pair of lift doors as one enters the main hotel lobby; you can't miss them! A very poor impression to make in one of the main public spaces of the hotel and, judging by other comments here, maybe it belies a lack of attention to detail with regard to decor generally. We had a table booked in the restaurant so went to the bar for a pre-lunch drink. When I enquired if we could add our drinks to our restaurant bill I was told in no uncertain terms that it was impossible as the tills in the two areas were "separate"! Incredible in this day and age!! Having ordered three drinks which came to over £20 I was then asked to pay £1.50 for a small bowl of peanuts!! Surely these could have been complimentary as in so many other similar establishments. This experience then coloured the rest of our visit I have to say.
reviews.title: Hotel/Restaurant

reviews.text: We were very surprised that we were only offered a "Prix Fixe" menu and no "A la Carte" option; one would have thought that an establishment that boasts of "Fine Dining" and two AA Rosettes would have been bound to offer more chioce. Our meal was good but not outstanding bearing in mind the prices charged and the food seemed overly fussy and was quite slow to appear. The restaurant was not very busy so there was little excuse on that front. My wife ordered scallops as a starter and there were two on the plate for £14!!! Our waitress was very pleasant and efficient, which was what one would expect with an establishment of this calibre.
reviews.title: Bar review

reviews.text: Would we go there again? Unlikely on this current performance I'm afraid! Very disappointing.
reviews.title: Had a lovely lunch here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to the Haven Hotel many times, over many years. My review relates solely to the bar in the circular lounge. I have noticed that the service is getting poorer and poorer as time goes by. Nearly always run by what appear to be badly trained staff, in a very muddled kind of set up. My visit today prompted this review. I requested 'a cup of hot water with a slice of lemon', and watched whilst a member of staff then proceeded to fill a pint beer glass with hot water from the machine. I had to stop her and point out that I had asked for a cup and not a pint glass. Is a cup of hot water with lemon such an unusual request? The cup of water was then placed on the bar, and on seeing me continue to stand there, I was then asked if I would like a saucer! On my second visit to the bar I requested the same again from another member of staff at the bar, 'a cup of hot water with a slice of lemon', and the had to stop this member of staff as she picked out a half pint glass and filled it with ice!
reviews.title: Fantastic location and service

reviews.text: Are the staff behind the bar trained at all in bar skills, and why do they simply not listen? Very badly run, and poorly trained.
reviews.title: 5 Days of Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night with my husband on 24th May. We have seen this hotel many times but not stayed before. I was a little concerned by some of the previous reviews (especially about the staff) but must say I found no grounding what-so-ever for these negative comments. Without exception every member of staff was polite, attentive and helpful. We were greeted by every member of staff we passed, they were all lovely. The staff in the restaurant were a delight and they enhanced an already wonderful dining experience. The food is AMAZING!! We also enjoyed the gentle entertainment during the evening...a lady singing in the bar (didn't catch her name - but she had a beautiful voice) We had a lovely room overlooking the sea, would have preferred a balcony room but that was out fault for not booking it. The view is breathtaking. Breakfast was buffet style, excellent quality and great choice. We didn't use the leisure facilities but will try them out next time because there will DEFINITELY be a next time!!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the positives. Fabulous location and the views are just wonderful. Food at dinner was good and breakfast selection was a bit better than OK. Then the negatives. Service in the restaurant was generally slow and forgetful, which gets annoying after a while. The hotel itself had a rather uncared-for feel: paint peeling, chips to furniture, marks on the wall and so on and this in May when we would have expected everything to be pristine after touch-up during the Winter. And we have just remembered the wretched TV which was just about unusable. Why not print some simple instructions for those of us too simple to use without. Despite the negatives, we would go back though we will carry a can of Dulux with us next time.
reviews.title: Views great but a bit of a tired feel to the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the setting and whilst the hotel is not 5 star the situation and the views are just stunning; we had a deluxe twin balcony room and my husband who expects the best and rarely comments was overwhelmed by the views and said he could stay in the room for a week and never get bored ! This is such a compliment,,,,, The staff are all superb, friendly efficient and made us welcome at every meeting; we ate in the restaurant which was both romantic and beautiful.. We love love love this hotel and we both have agreed it will be a twice a year treat... Room 221 will stay with us forever..... just a note on how good the team are, we were in Bournemouth waiting to go back to the hotel when the bar manager met us , remembered us and sat with us back to the hotel chatting and genuinely seemed interested, no big deal? he had been working until 3am that morning and was back there by 3pm in the afternoon,he could have just nodded and had 30 minutes to himself!! those little extras make this hotel a gem shhhhhhhhhhh keep it to yourself please
reviews.title: We came back and it was even better

reviews.text: This hotel is lovely , clean and tidy , rooms not luxurious but very liveable nice see view could do with an update now .. Staff very friendly and great service superb restaurant with great views and fab food .. It was bank holiday and very busy yet the hotel did not fault anything once .. Will go again soon
reviews.title: Fabulous location

reviews.text: Lovely hotel in an enviable position of the peninsula of sandbanks. Good food ,friendly staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful position - friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had an unexpected night in Poole having missed a ferry to Jersey. looked for hotel at short notice and was pleased to find not only was a double room available, but at reduced cost due to late booking. Upon checking in, as it was our first stay at the hotel we were upgraded to a sea view with balcony which was wonderful. The bedroom was perfect, large balcony with usual furniture. the bathroom however was very small and the shower over the bath was pathetic to say the least.
reviews.title: perfect position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception and dining room staff were very courteous and friendly, bar staff less helpful. It took me 15 mins to order a sandwich and drink as bar staff insisted food must be ordered from the restaurant, but restaurant staff said no, from the bar.
reviews.title: Beautiful location!
Beautiful food, beautiful location
reviews.text: Took diner in the restaurant where the food was excellent, but upon finding 2 pieces of wire in my starter, I complained to the waitress, who called the manager. Apologies were duly made, buy no reduction in our bill!!! I was too tired and frustrated to make a fuss but now wish I had, as if swallowed, I could have choked on this wire!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel but do haggle with prices, and check your food if eating in the restaurant!!!
reviews.title: Fell in love...can't wait to come back!

reviews.text: The hotel is in a fabulous location on the sea edge. We found all the staff at the hotel helpful, polite and welcoming. We had a delicious lunch on the terrace overlooking the sea with cocktails to follow. Although we didn't use the pool and spa they looked lovely. The sea views from our deluxe double room with balcony were second to none, the king size bed was comfortable too. The hotel is a little tied in places but it is quite old and easy to overlook as everything else is so wonderful. We walked on the beautiful sandy beach next to the hotel and the one opposite. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: family celebration

description: Idyllically located at the very tip of the exclusive Sandbanks peninsular and with uninterrupted views of Poole Harbour - the perfect base from which to visit the Purbecks and the Dorset's famous Jurassic coast. The Haven Hotel offers sheer award-winning luxury from its acclaimed restaurants to its heavenly Spa.
